article.description: David West scored 18 points and had 15 rebounds, adding to his legacy of dominating games against La Salle, as Xavier (No. 23 ESPN/USA Today) pulled away to an 80-47 victory on Tuesday night.
article.headline: West carries load in Xavier's rout
article.linkText: Xavier rolls as West still torments La Salle
article.story:
CINCINNATI (AP) -- David West scored 18 points and had 15
rebounds, adding to his legacy of dominating games against La
Salle, as Xavier (No. 23 ESPN/USA Today) pulled away to an 80-47 victory on Tuesday night.

	   Xavier (21-4, 2-1 Atlantic 10) has played solid games
back-to-back for the first time since senior point guard Lionel
Chalmers broke his foot on Dec. 31. West has carried the load since
then, getting little rest.

	   He was finally able to spend time on the bench after La Salle
(7-6, 1-2) fell behind in the first half and never recovered. The
Explorers finished with their most lopsided loss and their fewest
points of the season.

	   West had a career-high 31 points last season against La Salle,
which has tried every type of defense but failed to stop the
Preseason All-America forward. He also had 25 points in a win over
La Salle in 2001, a career high at that time.

	   Anthony Myles added 14 points, and Keith Jackson had 11 for
Xavier. Steven Smith had 16 points for La Salle, which had won four
of its last five games.

	   The Explorers fared much worse in their second visit to
Cincinnati this season. They played at Cincinnati on Dec. 14 and
overcame most of a 17-point deficit before losing 65-62, their
lowest scoring game until Tuesday.

	   It was no contest after Xavier went on a 19-2 run in the first
half. The Explorers shot only 25.8 percent from the field overall
as they struggled to find open shots against Xavier's man-to-man
defense.

	   Xavier's lack of depth became a problem once again when freshman
Dedrick Finn -- the Musketeers' only point guard -- got his second
foul at 13:28 of the first half.

	   Walk-on freshman guard Keenan Christiansen, who had appeared in
six games and scored two points, hit a 3-pointer and had seven
points to steady Xavier through a dominating first half. Xavier
used the 19-2 run to pull ahead 38-21 at halftime.

	   West and Myles led a 17-2 run early in the second half that
stretched the lead to 30 points. West blocked Jermaine Thomas' shot
and passed to Keith Jackson for a fast-break dunk during the spurt.

	   With his fourth block of the game, West became Xavier's career
leader, surpassing Aaron Williams' mark of 197.
